biography.value:
Amnizus lead infernal legions into battle and command guardians at the gateways to the Hells. Amnizus are arrogant, bullying, and ruthless, but theyâ€™re also highly intelligent tacticians and unfailingly loyalâ€”qualities the hellish archdukes value.

Some amnizus perform the critical task of watching over the River Styx from fortresses along the riverâ€™s blighted banks, where it flows through Dis and Stygia. They collect the souls arriving in the form of lemure;lemures (see the Monster Manual). Lemures have no personalities or memories; theyâ€™re driven only by the desire to commit evil. The amnizus that patrol here drill the rules of the Nine Hells into the new arrivalsâ€™ minds and marshal them into legions.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The amnizu uses Blinding Rot or Forgetfulness, if available. It also makes two Taskmaster Whip attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d8 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 3d10 type=force average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The amnizu targets one or two creatures that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a [[/save wis 19 format=long]] or take [[/damage 4d12 type=necrotic average=true]] damage and be &Reference[blinded]{blinded} until the start of the amnizuâ€™s next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The amnizu targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. That creature must succeed on a [[/save int 18 format=long]] or take [[/damage 4d12 type=psychic average=true]] damage and become &Reference[stunned]{stunned} for 1 minute. A &Reference[stunned]{stunned} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target is &Reference[stunned]{stunned} for the full minute, it forgets everything it sensed, experienced, and learned during the last 5 hours.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The amnizu summons 2d4 bearded devil;bearded devils or 1d4 barbed devil;barbed devils (both appear in the Monster Manual). A summoned devil appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the amnizu, acts as an ally of the amnizu, and canâ€™t summon other devils. It remains for 1 minute, until the amnizu dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The amnizu casts one of the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components and using &Reference[int]{Intelligence} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19):

At will: command

3/day: dominate monster

1/day: feeblemind

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Devilâ€™s Sight. Magical darkness doesnâ€™t impede the amnizuâ€™s &Reference[darkvision]{darkvision}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Magic Resistance. The amnizu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
When a creature within 60 feet of the amnizu makes an attack roll against it, and another creature is within the attackâ€™s range, the attacker must make a [[/save wis 19 format=long]]. On a failed save, the attacker must target the creature that is closest to it, not including the amnizu or itself. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target. If the saving throw is successful, the attacker is immune to the amnizuâ€™s Instinctive Charm for 24 hours.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is &Reference[undead]{undead}, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target falls &Reference[prone]{prone} and then ends its turn.

Halt. The target doesn't move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

macro.name: Command

description.value:
You attempt to beguile a creature that you can see within range. It must succeed on a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw or be &Reference[charmed]{charmed} by you for the duration. If you or creatures that are friendly to you are fighting it, it has advantage on the saving throw.

While the creature is &Reference[charmed]{charmed}, you have a telepathic link with it as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the creature while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey. You can specify a simple and general course of action, such as "Attack that creature," "Run over there," or "Fetch that object." If the creature completes the order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it defends and preserves itself to the best of its ability.

You can use your action to take total and precise control of the target. Until the end of your next turn, the creature takes only the actions you choose, and doesn't do anything that you don't allow it to do. During this time, you can also cause the creature to use a reaction, but this requires you to use your own reaction as well.

Each time the target takes damage, it makes a new &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell with a 9th-level spell slot, the duration is &Reference[concentration]{concentration}, up to 8 hours.

You blast the mind of a creature that you can see within range, attempting to shatter its intellect and personality. The target takes 4d6 &Reference[psychic]{psychic} damage and must make an &Reference[int]{Intelligence} saving throw.

On a failed save, the creature's &Reference[int]{Intelligence} and &Reference[cha]{Charisma} scores become 1. The creature can't cast spells, activate magic items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. The creature can, however, identify its friends, follow them, and even protect them.

At the end of every 30 days, the creature can repeat its saving throw against this spell. If it succeeds on its saving throw, the spell ends.

The spell can also be ended by greater restoration, heal, or wish.
